intro: Hieracium macrodon subsp. rupicolifrons, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. The plant features a rosette of basal leaves that are usually hairy and have a rough texture. Its flowering stems bear yellow composite flowers, which are composed of numerous small florets. This subspecies is notable for its ecological role in stabilizing soil in high-altitude habitats.
